abstract: News that Home Depot may receive less than $10.3 billion for the sale of its professional supply unit helped drive the home-improvement retailer’s shares down more than 4.8 percent in afternoon trading Thursday. But despite the company’s terse explanation that financing conditions prompted the move, we’re still skeptical.
lead_paragraph: News that Home Depot may receive less than $10.3 billion for the sale of its professional supply unit helped drive the home-improvement retailer’s shares down more than 4.8 percent in afternoon trading Thursday. But despite the company’s terse explanation that financing conditions prompted the move, we’re still skeptical.

headline.main: Why Is Home Depot Back at the Table?
